rows.text: On the exploration map you can manage your party by pressing I or clicking on the bottom bar.
To manage your Team while on the exploration map, press Y.
Once you are engaged in a battle you can't switch your gear. Choose wisely!
Every weapon and armor type has a unique special ability that can make the difference between success and failure!
If one of your party members is knocked out you can bring them back by using a medkit on them when standing next to them. If you wait too long, they will die!
You can use medkits outside of battle by right-clicking them on the team screen!
You can use medkits outside of battle from the Team page in your Journal!
Sell your unused items at the trader by right-clicking them. The cash will come in handy later!
Sell your unused items at the trader by pressing A. The cash will come in handy later!
Keep an eye on your ammo and fuel count. If you run out of either resource you will be in trouble!
Every member of your party can perform two actions in one turn. There are three types of actions: Attack, Move and Neutral. Attack and Move can only be done once a turn, Neutral up to two.
Cover reduces your chance of hitting a target. If you can aim at a target without cover you have a 100% hit chance. Flanking your enemies is one of the best strategies!
Use walls and large objects to your advantage as they break the line of sight.
Armor always absorbs damage first. It is especially effective against splinter damage weapons like Shotguns!
There is a small chance for you to evade an attack independent of hit probability.
Every character can carry three items at once: One Weapon, one auxiliary item and one armor. Picking the right gear largely determines your strategy.
A character begins with a unique set of skills. As they gain experience and level up they will be able to unlock new perks and skills.
In order to equip a weapon a character must have the appropriate skill.
Some perks will open up new choices during events. These unique options are marked with an extra border.
Pistols have the special ability Double Shot. This performs a hip shot at two different enemies in rapid succession!
Sniper Rifles can be used to set an Ambush. An enemy moving or planning to attack within the ambush area will be attacked!
Rifles allow you to Burst attack. A burst will spread across multiple tiles in a line and damage any units within.
Shotguns can perform a powerful Blast attack, damaging all units in a cone straight in front of you.
Knives have a special ability called Bleed, which as the name indicates will cause enemies to bleed over a couple of turns.
All special abilities cost bravery points. You can gain bravery points by successfully attacking, evading enemy attacks, healing your units, and repairing their armors.
Knives have the highest damage potential in the game. You must however expose yourself by moving close!
Sniper Rifles can cover large areas with their high range.
Some battle locations contain explosive barrels. Shoot them and they will explode causing damage to surrounding enemies!
Medkits restore health and revive unconscious characters. Repairkits restore armor.
You can perform your actions during battle in any order!
Don't forget to take your loot with you after a successful battle!
Knives are a great backup option for when you run out of ammo!
Light Armors enable your character to use the ability Sprint, allowing them to cover a much longer distance in one move.
Medium Armors give your character the Low Profile ability. When activated, the character receives a temporary Evade boost.
Heavy Armors allow your character to Hunker Down. It temporarily reduces all damage taken!
When your character is out of moves a little tick will appear next to their vitals just above the head.
You can see your character's and your enemy's basic vitals hovering above their head.
Hovering over a location on the exploration map will reveal some basic info about that location.
Resting places, traders and recruiting events can be revisited.
If you are at a location that can be revisited (such as a trader), simply click on it again to revisit.
